settings.text: Can I use IPL on my bikini line?
settings.text1: Yes, Ulike IPL can be used on the skin around the genitals, including the bikini line, Brazilian wax area, and buttocks. However, avoid using it directly on the genitals.

settings.text: How does Ulike support its claim of 93% hair reduction in 4 weeks?
settings.text1: Ulike IPL devices undergo rigorous testing at the world-renowned SGS laboratory. The Air 3 demonstrated a 93% reduction in hair count in the bikini area within 4 weeks with 3 treatments per week. Results may vary based on factors such as genetics, hair colour, and skin tone.
settings.text4:
* The specific results vary from person to person, and the use time  can be extended
according to the thickness of the hair until the desired results are achieved.

settings.text: Is IPL safe for long-term use?
settings.text1: Yes, research supports that IPL is generally considered safe for long-term use. To achieve the best results and maintain smooth skin, monthly touch-ups are recommended.

settings.text: Why is the Air 3's smaller footprint an advantage?
settings.text1: In addition to being lightweight and easier to manoeuvre than bulkier devices, the Air 3’s treatment head is nearly as wide as the device itself, ensuring that you don’t miss any spots.

settings.text: How does Ulike support its claim of 93% hair reduction in 4 weeks?
settings.text1: Ulike IPL devices undergo rigorous testing at the world-renowned SGS laboratory. The Air 3 demonstrated a 93% reduction in hair count in the bikini area within 4 weeks with 3 treatments per week. Results may vary based on factors such as genetics, hair colour, and skin tone.

settings.text: How does Ulike support its claim of 93% hair reduction in 4 weeks?
settings.text1: Ulike IPL devices undergo rigorous testing at the world-renowned SGS laboratory. The Air 3 demonstrated a 93% reduction in hair count in the bikini area within 4 weeks with 3 treatments per week. Results may vary based on factors such as genetics, hair colour, and skin tone.

settings.text: What makes Ulike's flat lamp head design unique?
settings.text2:
Flat head

- No missed spots

- Prevents burns

- Easy to clean

Concave head

- Inconsistent coverage

- Burns and irritation

- Residue build-up

settings.text: What makes Ulike's flat lamp head design unique?
settings.text1: The flat lamp head design of the Air 3 allows our Ice Cooling technology to uniformly cool the skin, preventing the treatment temperature from rising and potentially harming the skin.

settings.text: How does IPL work?
settings.text2: IPL targets the melanin in hair follicles during their growth phase (anagen phase).
settings.text3: The light disrupts the hair growth cycle, putting the follicles into a dormant state.
settings.text4: As a result, hair grows back thinner and slower, and eventually stops growing altogether.

settings.title: Can everyone use IPL?
settings.content:
IPL (Intense Pulsed Light) hair removal works by emitting intense light pulses that are absorbed by the pigment in the hair follicles. The absorbed light is then converted into heat, which targets the hair follicles and inhibits future hair growth.

It is important to note that IPL is most effective on individuals with lighter skin tones and darker hair colours. This is because the light energy is primarily absorbed by the melanin pigment in the hair. In individual's skin that's rich in melanin, the excess melanin can also absorb the light energy, leading to potential skin damage.

Similarly, IPL may not be as effective on individuals with light hair colours such as blonde, gray, or red. This is because these hair colours have less melanin content, making it challenging for the IPL device to target the hair follicles effectively.

To ensure the effectiveness and safety of IPL hair removal, we recommend users to refer to the provided skin tone chart before making a purchase.

settings.title: I’m not familiar with IPL. Is it safe?
settings.content: IPL is a clinically-backed method for long-term hair removal. Air 3 is CE/UKCA cleared, expert backed, clinically tested and complies with international regulation standards. It’s safe, effective, and convenient.

settings.title: Who should not use IPL?
settings.content:
IPL hair removal device is not recommended if you have any of the following:

- A known skin disorder

- Skin diseases such as allergic dermatitis, eczema, etc.

- Photosensitive epilepsy or Photosensitivity

- Are menstruating, pregnant, or lactating

- Dark black or Sunburnt skin (please refer to the skin tone chart)

- Broken skin, a scab or healed wound, cancer or hemangioma

- Any artificial aesthetic, prosthetic, or plastic area

- Tattoo area

settings.title: Why choose IPL technology for hair removal?
settings.content: IPL, or intense pulsed light, uses strong pulses of broad-spectrum light to target hair at the root. The light is absorbed by the melanin in the hair follicle, where it is then converted into heat, resulting in thinner regrowth and eventually stopping hair growth altogether. Ulike IPL devices are FDA/UKCA cleared and offer a cost-effective, convenient solution compared to clinic laser and traditional methods of hair removal.

settings.title: I have PCOS. Is it suitable for me?
settings.content: Air 3 IPL hair removal is designed to provide long-term hair reduction, even for those with persistant or abnormal hair growth. We recommend consulting with your healthcare professional for specific PCOS related questions before beginning IPL treatment.

settings.title: How often should I use this product?
settings.content:
We recommend using the device three times a week for the first month to achieve the best results. After that, you can use it once every two weeks or once a month for touch-ups as needed.

Furthermore, we advise tailoring your usage according to your hair growth. If you encounter areas with thicker hair or stubbornness, feel free to elevate the gear level and frequency of usage. Always pay attention to your skin's response and adjust accordingly to ensure your comfort and avoid any discomfort or adverse effects.

settings.title: Does IPL hair remover hurt?
settings.content: IPL hair removal is generally considered to be much less painful and nearly as effective as laser hair removal. Additionally, Ulike is the company that employs Sapphire Ice-Cooling technology to ensure nearly Painless sessions.

settings.title: Can I use the device on all parts of my body?
settings.content: Yes, you can use Ulike IPL devices on almost every part of your body. However, please avoid using it directly on your genitals, eyes, tattooed areas or parts of the skin with open wounds. To ensure your comfort, we recommend treating sensitive areas such as the bikini area, inner thighs, and buttocks with the lowest power level.

settings.text: Global IPL Device Sales
settings.des: Source: Frost&Sullivan, confirmed based on research on global hair removal device market and calculated by 2023 global sales volume metrics. Hair removal device refers to a beauty instrument that targets hair follicles using technologies such as laser and intense pulsed light (IPL), with the aim of reducing or removing hair. The survey was completed in October 2024.
